intro: Dasiphora rigida, commonly known as stiffleaf clover, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, rigid stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in raceme clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its root system is capable of nitrogen fixation, making it valuable for soil enrichment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and meadows.
